pr_title: Convert the pxf-api project to a boot project

timeline.message:
Convert the pxf-api project to a boot project

- Provide a top level build.gradle with only pxf-api enabled
- Provide a build.gradle for pxf-api
- Migrate unit tests to JUnit 5
- Make all unit tests pass

timeline.bodyText: I'd assume these whole file changes came with the upgraded Gradle version, right ?
timeline.author: denalex

timeline.bodyText:
wonder what annotationProcessor does here and the difference between api and implementation dependencies.
Also, the JAR produced will not have any dependencies included (not a fat jar), so I assume we will handle it somewhere else.

replies.bodyText:
Here's some info about API vs implementation: https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/java_library_plugin.html#sec:java_library_separation This is also a good read: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44413952/gradle-implementation-vs-api-configuration
Here's some info about annotationProcessor: https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/java_plugin.html#making_an_annotation_processor_incremental
